name: Sonoma Orchid Inn

reviews.text: During a 10 day trip through California, 3 nights were spent at the wonderful Orchid Inn. The hosts were very nice, friendly, and willing to help out as much as they could.
reviews.title: Forget the Wine Tours, the Breakfasts were the Highlight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a great sleep, we woke to eat the most delicious breakfast. The seating area allows guests to sit and talk with other guests. After breakfast, the hosts spent time showing us which wineries would be best for us and even provided cards that would enable us to have free wine tastings.
reviews.title: Nice, but not amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A kitchen is supplied with a fridge, microwave, water, juice, freshly baked cookies, wine glasses, a book of restaurants and wineries to visit, etc.
reviews.title: Great B&B, Excellent Hosts!

likes.disliked: — size of room was a little small, but we chose that one for price savings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bedrooms were either in the main house or a seperate building. The rooms were all different, and had their own character. Each contained a TV, with either a DVD player or VCR and movies (and books) were supplied in the living room. Each room also had its own bathroom.
reviews.title: Exceed expectations and does not disappoint

likes.disliked: — Not close to my house. LOL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They helped us make a reservation at a beautiful restaurant and helped us out when we ran into minor problems, at no extra cost. Wireless Internet was also supplied for all guests, that could also be used outside on the patio area. Although we did not use the hot tub, there was one that other guests used.
reviews.title: Lovely all over!
Love it!
reviews.text: You cannot go wrong at this B&B! The owners were totally made to run a B&B with their helpful advice and easy going ways. The inn is crisp, clean, private and cozy. An amazing breakfast will start your day right. It is a great location for Sonoma winerys and popping out to the ocean. Hope you love it too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sonoma Orchid Inn's owners, Brian and Dana, were very helpful. The breakfasts were delicious and looked forward to each day! Something to note: The Sonoma Orchid Inn is not in the heart of Sonoma Wine Country, but is considered part of Russian River Wine country. The winery's are more laid back, less crowded, and mostly known for pinot noirs. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this inn, however, there were a limited number of places to eat in Guerneville itself and the next nearest town, is 10 to 15 minutes drive away.
reviews.title: Worth considering...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. Dana and Brian made us feel right at home immediately and went out of their way to help us plan our meals, trips to wineries, and other tourist activitivies with us. We also enjoyed their gourment breakfasts and the casual dining atomosphere. The room we booked was clean, comfortable, and well appointed.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would certainly stay there again if our travels ever take us to Sonoma.
reviews.title: Quiet and Comfortable Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dan & Stephanie
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B and Owners!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second 4 night visit. Our hosts, Dana and Brian, were professional, considerate and very helpful. The breakfasts and afternoon cookies are fabulous. This is the perfect place to stay to tour wine country, take a day trip to San Francisco, Napa or Mendocino, or just plain chill. We love this place and will continue to return.
reviews.title: Second time even better

reviews.text: I spent three nights last week over my spring break at the Sonoma Orchid Inn.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at the Sonoma Orchid Inn

likes.liked: — Dog friendly owners, room and grounds that were comfortable and first rate.

reviews.text: It was just the rest and relaxation the doctor ordered!
reviews.title: The Best Vacation I've Had in Years

likes.liked: — The ambience, the hospitality, and the great breakfasts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn and it's grounds are lovely. My pups and I loved our comfortable suite with a private side entrance. Brian and Dana were wonderful hosts. Dana's gourmet breakfasts were delicious. Brian did a fine job with the fruit salad and coffee.
reviews.title: Quick but pleasant stay at the Sonoma Orchid Inn

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, great breakfast, wonderful hosts, much cheaper than napa
likes.disliked: — A little out of the way, but not bad if you like some solitude...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn is centrally located to Sonoma wineries, the Redwood forests, and Bodega Bay. We enjoyed wonderful walks in the woods and the beach. Plus, I had some fantastic restaurant recommendations. The only downside to the convenience is some minor traffic noise off of River Road.
reviews.title: We'll be back

likes.disliked: — We didn't stay long enough. Next time we will stay longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a busy couple days in the city we ended our vacation at The Sonoma Orchid Inn. It was such a relief to have a relaxing atmosphere and such hospitable inn keepers. The delicious breakfast was the highlight of our stay. But the inn keepers were also very knowledgable about the surrounding area and activities.
reviews.title: Relaxing B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, we immediately felt at home and welcomed. Brian and Dana are very gracious hosts and provided us with not only the best breakfasts we've ever had, but excellent suggestions on how to make the most of our stay in the Russian River Valley. Every detail was accounted for, from cleanliness to comfort to the chocolate chip cookie nightcap, it was truly perfect. We are looking forward to celebrating our most special occasions there in the future. For nature lovers, the nearby Armstrong State Forest is a must for seeing ancient old growth coast redwoods in their natural state, and is just around the corner. We will definintely be returning and have made many recommendations to friends and family.
reviews.title: Luxury and comfort, can't wait to return!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked 3 nights at the Inn last August as part of our tour of North California. I was really looking forward to the stay and we certainly weren't disappointed! Brian and Dana are very kind and attentive hosts. Despite arriving late, we were shown to the place and to our room on the night we arrive and the talk of the gourmet breakfast made my taste buds tingle in anticipation. Every morning we were served a delicious and hearty breakfast, with different dishes everyday.
reviews.title: Like staying with friends, and one of them is a chef!

likes.liked: — Homely feel, gourmet breakfast, warm welcome, quiet location
likes.disliked: — Have to drive to go out in the evening

reviews.text: Brian and Dana patiently shared some tips with us on what to see and do. They are passionate about the area and that shows. They will even book a restaurant for you.
reviews.title: May favorite new spot!
This one is a must!!
reviews.text: The guest kitchen is a very nice touch and the chunky chocolate cookies a delight!!

description: Sonoma Orchid Inn - it's all about location, stylish comfort and convenience. Exit the urban scene for an escape to the country. The redwoods rise, the vineyards yield fog-kissed premier Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, the coast beckons, and the scenery
